intro: Euryops thunbergii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Euryops thunbergii is widely cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
